revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Linksys |model=WRT1200AC |revision=v2 |asin=B00UVN20T0 |newegg=9SIA00Y4536323 |est_release_date=07/2016 |fcc_date=06/28/2016 |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |manuf=Wistron NeWeb |availability=now |type=wireless router |fcc_id=Q87-WRT1200AC |ic_id=3839A-WRT1200AC |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=2.5 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=Marvell |cpu1_model=88F6820;88F6820-A0, C133, (Armada 385); |cpu1_cspeed=1.33 GHz |cpu1_cores=2 |fla1=128 |fla1_brand=Spansion |fla1_model=S34ML01G100TFI00 |ram1=512 |ram1_brand=SK hynix |ram1_model=H5TQ2G63FFR-PBC |ram1_num=2 |expansion_if_types=USB 3.0, USB 2.0 / eSATA (combo port) |expansion_usb_num=2 |expansion_sata_num=1 |jtag=yes,, 20-pin header |serial=yes,, 4-pin header,, (115200,8,N,1) |wi1_chip1_brand=Marvell |wi1_chip1_model=88W8864 |wi1_802dot11_protocols=an+ac |wi1_ant_conn=MHF4,RP-SMA |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=2 |wi1_sstreams=2 |wi2_chip1_brand=Marvell |wi2_chip1_model=88W8864 |wi2_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi2_ant_conn=MHF4,RP-SMA |wi2_txchains=2 |wi2_rxchains=2 |wi2_sstreams=2 |eth_cpu=true |sw_brand=Marvell |sw_model=88E6176 |lan_speed=1G |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports=1 |addl_chips=2.4GHz Power Amplifier Module;Skyworks;SE2623L;;2; ,,, 5GHz SPDT Switch with LNA;Skyworks;SKY85601;;2; ,,, 5GHz Power Amplifier IC;RFMD;RFPA5522;;2; |stock_boot=U-Boot |stock_os=Linux |tp_firmware= OpenWrt, McDebian, DD-WRT, |802dot11_protocols=abgn+ac }} {{TagLine|AC1200 Dual-Band Smart Wi-Fi Wireless Router}} - '''Caiman''' :{{ProductPage|http://www.linksys.com/us/p/P-WRT1200AC/}}{{SupportPage|vendor=Linksys|model=WRT1200AC|pid=01t80000003pjNKAAY}}
*According to Class II Permissive Change documentation submitted :to the FCC on 06/27/2016, this router is "electrically identical" to the :[[Linksys WRT1200AC v1|WRT1200AC v1]]. All information is copied from that device entry.
Per '''Linksys''' (LinksysCares@linksys.com), regarding the WRT1900ACS v1 vs v2, [https://community.linksys.com/t5/Wireless-Routers/WRT1900ACS-V1-vs-V2-hardware-changes/td-p/1047601 the only difference between revisions where the Wi-Fi driver looks up the wireless power tables]. [https://github.com/kaloz/mwlwifi/commit/d59c06448cc438243f0043d8b37485196998b288 Newer devices have the power table + region code embedded, older rev. mvebu routers should use the power table specified in dts'']. :[https://dev.openwrt.org/browser/trunk/target/linux/mvebu/files/arch/arm/boot/dts/armada-385-linksys-caiman.dts?rev=45456 '''armada-385-linksys-caiman.dts''' on the '''OpenWrt''' Trac] showing the powertable used for the WRT1200ACv1
===Wikis=== *[https://github.com/Chadster766/McDebian/wiki On the '''McDebian''' Wiki] *{{WPLink|Linksys_routers#WRT1200AC}} *[https://openwrt.org/toh/linksys/wrt_ac_series On the '''OpenWrt''' Wiki] :[https://openwrt.org/toh/linksys/wrt_ac_series#wrt1200ac WRT1200AC] - [[Marvell]] Armada 385 @1.3GHz (Caiman)
===Reviews=== *[http://www.smallnetbuilder.com/wireless/wireless-reviews/32695-linksys-wrt1200ac-dual-band-gigabit-wi-fi-router-reviewed On '''SmallNetBuilder'''] :CPU: [[Marvell]] 88F6820; 88F6820-A0 C133 (Armada 385 @1.33GHz) *[http://www.smallnetbuilder.com/wireless/wireless-reviews/32774-linksys-high-gain-antennas-reviewed ''Linksys'' High Gain Antennas Reviewed]
===See also=== [[List of Four Stream Hardware]] *[[Linksys WRT32X]] *[[Linksys WRT3200ACM]] *[[Linksys WRT1900AC v1]] *[[Linksys WRT1900AC v2]] *[[Linksys WRT1900ACS]] *[[Linksys WRT1200AC v1]] *[[Linksys WRT1200AC v2]]
